summary: In this context, 1,4-dichlorobenzene and trichlorobenzene are both mentioned as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) included in a study of priority hazardous substances in the southern North Sea. They are part of a broader list of chlorinated hydrocarbons (CHCs) and monoaromatic hydrocarbons (MAHs) monitored over a three-year period. However, there is no specific discussion of their interactions, properties, or significance relative to each other within the study.
